Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on the Impact of Race Correction Removal in Pulmonary Function Tests for African American Lung Cancer Patients

Trial_Design.evidence: Surgeons were randomised to receive clinical vignettes with race-corrected or race-neutral PFTs.

Participants.evidence: Participants were African American patients undergoing lung cancer resection from January 1, 2015, to September 31, 2022.

Intervention.evidence: Surgeons were randomised to receive clinical vignettes with race-corrected or race-neutral PFTs.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the change in treatment recommendations, measured immediately after vignette presentation.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Among 225 surgeons, those receiving race-corrected vignettes recommended lobectomy more frequently.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Race-neutral equations would have decreased preoperative and postoperative FEV1 by 9.2% and 7.6%, respectively.
